column4: Where are most user installed .sh programs installed?  I'm giving Zimbra desktop a shot and it wants to put the install in /root/zimbra/zdesktop.
think of /root as the equivalent of your /home/Scunizi directory... not a good place for applications...
installed with sudo so it's going into root.. I would think.. otherwise the directory referance would be /home/foobar
does it require root privs?
yes
should I set zimbra to install in /usr/share?
i don't know. It probably wants to be installed in /root for a reason, whether good or bad.
ok.. it looks easy enough to uninstall if necessary.. thanks.
thanks. maybe I should have installed the gnome version?  there are two in synaptic.
if you look up routeplanner with << apt-cache show routeplanner >> it has a field "Suggests: routeplanner-gnome". This should have displayed somewhere when you installed the package.
it didn't but thanks.. I'll reload the gnome version.
python program
It's routeplanner.. still can't get it running even after installing -gnome version.. no icon and I'm not sure what to use at the command line to start it.
so its not in the applications menu>
no.
open up a terminal and type,  locate routeplanner | xargs file | grep -i exec
actually, you'll have to update the database first with   sudo updatedb
already did that.. your line shows 3 executibles.
and is routeplanner one of them?
all three mention routeplanner then .postinst and .prerm and .postrm as the suffix on routeplanner.
nickrud's line shows different results.. rplan and rpcli.  these are also located in /usr/bin instead of /var/lib/dpkg......etc.
